channel.title: [Class Suggestion] Spy/Double Agent
channel.description:
<big>[color=blue]The Spy[/color]</big> **[color=grey]Blue Dragon Social[/color]**
**Mole (Passive) -** Will see the votes when a new King is elected, and if the new king is a royal. *You will keep this passive even if your class changes.* **Connections (Day) -** Force the court to pardon the player on trial currently. They cannot be put on trial again for the rest of the day. *(1 use)* **Snoop (Night) -** Read a player's journal. *(2 uses)* **Bug (Night) -** Send a scout to a chosen player. At the beginning of each night, the scout alerts you if the target used a day ability, and if one was used, what it was. Regains uses upon the scouted player dying. *(2 uses)* *Your objective is to defeat the Unseen or Cult, and any neutrals that seek to do you harm.*
When converted, becomes...
<big>[color=indigo]Double Agent[/color]</big> **[color=grey]Unseen Offensive[/color]**
**Mole (Passive) -** Will see the classes of players who step up during the election of a new king.
**Plant Evidence (Day) -** Frame a chosen player. They will appear suspicious to investigative classes during the next night. *(3 uses)*
**Blackmail (Night) -** Blackmail a player, preventing them from speaking during the next trial. *(3 uses)* **Forge (Night) -** Choose a player and rewrite their Logs at night. If they die, their Logs are replaced with your rewritten ones. *(2 uses)*
*Your objective is to defeat the Blue Dragon, and any neutrals that seek to do you harm.*
-----
**Explanation of Design**
The idea behind the passive of the spy is to fill another role that a prior patch opened up (information on king election).
The rest of their kit is to create a sort of reverse [color=blue]Noble[/color]. The **Bug** ability catches day abilities, which would want to be used to find Assassin/CL/Nk. This is the opposite of **Gossip**, which requires the noble to out themselves to be effective at finding fake-claims. In addition, bug can find classes that cannot be found with the Noble's gossip. The **Snoop** night action is subject to change, but functions in a way to dig up specific information and has internal synergy with **Bug**, albeit incredibly delayed. It's a flavor thing. The reason for having **Connections** is to be in line with the other easily confirmed BD social classes, with some other minor actual applications.
In regards to the [color=darkpurple]Double Agent[/color], the main inspirations were numerous mafia deception roles from ToS. The intention of this converted class is to, among other things, is to sow deception in a similar manner to Herbalist. Like the Illusionist, the Double Agent's ability to play the role of a Spy is extremely difficult, and will quickly lead to their death if suspicion of a Double Agent existing arises.
